column4: from a terminal, run 'gksudo gdmsetup' -- does this work? If not, does it report an error in the terminal?
it does the same thing, the window appears for half a second then goes
it does the same thing, the window appears for half a second then goes
you could run 'sudo strace gdmsetup', see if you can make sense of the output
it'll probably tell you what it fails on
you ecpect me to read about 1,000 pages of info?!
hint: what you're looking for is probably at the end of this output
lots of missing thumbnail pngs and a segmentation fault
do you get segfaults with any other programs?
try a 'sudo apt-get --reinstall install gdm' and retry gksudo gdmsetup
sudo didnt ask for pass and this happened:
no i can't quit synaptic, it's still updating
it's not sensible to run gdmsetup while you're updating, anyway
i spose, but it's not actually installing yet, it's just downloading packages
and do you see lots of help pouring in as a result? No, you've just managed to annoy.
